headline: Fresh Strawberry Pie with Jell-O
description: This strawberry pie with Jell-O is super easy to make with strawberry gelatin and juicy strawberries for a fresh-tasting, no-bake summer dessert.
name: Fresh Strawberry Pie with Jell-O

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk sugar and cornstarch together in a saucepan until completely blended. Pour in boiling water and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in gelatin mix until smooth. Let mixture cool to room temperature, 15 to 30 minutes.
While the mixture is cooling, place strawberries into baked pie shells with the points facing up.
Pour cooled gelatin mixture over strawberries and refrigerate until set, about 2 hours.

review.reviewBody: Takes a while to thicken the sugar sauce, and also have to spend some time blending in the Jell-O to eliminate the gritty texture. A quick and easy desert that's not that bad. Did use extra thick whipped cream, that made it part of the dish and not just a topping.

So easy, looks amazing. I did only use 1/2 cup sugar, and added 2 drops mint extract. Used Premade Graham Cracker Crust. Decorated with a few blueberries for color. Followed great tip that said boil cornstarch, sugar and water until clear (approx. 5 minutes) BEFORE adding Strawberry gelatin. Definitely a keeper!
Made this recipe for first time year. Everyone loves this recipe. Yummy 😋
It turned out great! I wouldn’t change a thing!! I’m about to make my second one. Thanks for a great, easy recipe!! 🥰
Loved it! Used fresh ontario strawberries. Made two pies. Topped with a little bit of whipped cream, perfect pie for summer
Very tasty

This is very easy to make. I slice the strawberries in halves and quarters, depending on sizes.
I also mix about 1/4 cup of cream cheese with about 2 teaspoons of sugar and "paint" this on the bottom of the pie crust before pouring in gelatin to keep the crust from getting soggy. We love this pie!
Great recipe.... I use cold water when mixing with the cornstarch sugar mixture.
This recipe was delicious, I made one big pie with this and had to double the jello, mixture. This pie was gone in minutes.
Easy and delicious.
My first pie in 10 years, second only pie ever made. This was fabulous! Thank you very good recipe. The jello helps the pie slices keep their shape! Super tasty, Very Pretty pie!
I loved it! Definitely only enough for one pie though.
The taste was delicious, however it needed more gel mixture. When we cut it, all the strawberries on top fell off.
Not bad for the first time making a pie. Next time I will reduce the sugar or use a sugar free jello as I personally thought it was overly sweet.
I added 1 cup pureed strawberries when I was thickening on the stove. Haven't tried it yet. Still cooling.
I didn't buy enough Strawberries but it was still fantastic!

This is a long time family favorite. I have been making it for 25+ years and it is always perfect. Let me say however, this recipe makes 1 pie, not 2. 
Also, for those that say that it didn't set up, when using cornstarch as a thickening agent what ever you are making must boil for a couple of minutes. Just adding boiling water or bringing it to a boil won't work. Rule of thumb with this recipe is boil until clear, remove from heat and stir in jello.
just like my mom makes it

I made a couple strawberry pies for my ladies Bunco group and they're were begging me to make it again!! I combined the cornstarch, water, jello and sugar in a saucepan- brought to a boil over med heat, then once it reached a boil, I let it cook for 5 more min, whisking often. Make sure you let the glaze completely cool before pouring over the strawberries. I used a 9" pie pan and about 4 baskets of fresh strawberries. I made a crust out of shortbread cookies and topped the pie with fresh real whipped cream!! DELCIOUS!

No changes were necessary to this recipe, it comes out exactly as promised and is delicious! From my own errors, use slightly larger pie crusts or smaller pie plates so the crust is uniform, and spray or butter the pie plate before baking the crust into it- this pie sticks like crazy (but was worth every crumb).

Pretty good pie. Easy recipe till you get to the glaze. Mine was too thick by the time it was at room temperature. I had to add some hot water to thin it out, enough to be able to spread it over the berries. I will cut the corn starch amount by half next time. I will also reduce the sugar by half, the jello mix is plenty sweet..

This pie was amazing and so easy to make. I halved all of my strawberries and arranged them with the uncut sides facing up. Made with the “Basic Flaky Pie Crust” recipe from this site... after baking the shell I coated with a thin layer of melted chocolate chips. A thanksgiving dinner hit!

This was so quick and easy to make, and came out DELICIOUS!!!

Thank you Allrecipes!

I never realized how easy it is to make strawberry pie! Instead of a regular pie crust, I bought a pre made kebbler shortbread crust, and after putting Ready whip on top, i added a few blueberries. DELICIOUS!!!!!!

My husband, and everyone else, absolutely loved this pie. I made the addition that his mom did, when she baked it for him as a boy. She spread softened cream cheese over bottom of the cooled crust. I also cut the strawberries in quarters and then spread them out over the cream cheese. The gelatin mixture was only a thin layer, but gave just enough to complement the other ingredients. Topped with real whipped cream. It was a huge hit for hubby's 70th birthday and took him back to his younger years.
This was pretty good. I was Leary of the artificial flavor of the strawberry jello

we had fresh strawberries fm u- pick outing,
 made chilled choco graham crust, the glaze was barely enough for one pie. did slice and arranges the berries, instead of water used juice and half the sugar.
Fast, easy, delicious! The trifecta in perfect Strawberry pies!
will be a big hit at church. suggest including blind baking pie shell instructions for the less experienced
Came out great.I added some kiwis as well as extra strawberries..I would double the recipes for two pies though.

This is the easiest winning-est recipe ever. I've made it numerous times, always with no recipe adjustments. I use pre-made (refrigerated) pie crusts. The pie is pretty with the strawberries standing up. Everyone who tastes it wants the recipe. It is best when berries are in season, of course, but is even very good (and a surprise) when the berries are purchased from the grocery store any time of year. I always make two pies and serve with whipped cream. Fresh taste.
I used sugar free strawberry Jello and "cook and serve" Jello Vanillla pudding in my strawberry pie. That sure cuts down on the calories.
I reduced the sugar to 3/4 cup and still thought it was too sweet. This recipe makes enough for one pie.

My mother made this same recipe for years, however she cut the sugar to 1/2 C and the Jello to 1/2 small package. The amount called for are for a single pie as many others have noted. It's the best strawberry pie ever in my opinion.
Perfect strawberry pie recipe. I use a ready made shortbread pie crust. Make sure the filling cools completely before pouring it over the strawberries!!
You only need 1 pie shell and 1 container of berries. Great recipe especially when using commercial berries which are not as sweet as my own.

This was a good base recipe, but as some others did we changed it up just a bit. This was only enough liquid for ONE 9 inch pie; and we even added 1/2 cup more boiling water. The only other change we made was 1/2 cup sugar instead of 1 cup. It solidified and was perfect tasting for our pie. Thanks for sharing!

I left the strawberries whole - just cut off the green bit, and piled them high (2 lbs for 1 pie), then poured on the glaze. It set beautifully and looked so decadent! Serve with fresh cream to bring on the ooohs and ahhs! (I might use less than the cup of sugar next time, it was very sweet... but delicious!)

No changes and it was perfect and delicious. I can't understand people who change the recipe and then rate it poorly. If you aren't going to use the recipe as is, don't bother to rate it unless you have improved it.

It looked and smelled good, but it was too soupy! I made it for a co-worker's birthday and was disappointed with the results. Lesson learned: take the thickening step seriously. I pulled it from the heat and added jello as soon as it started showing signs of thickening because, foolish me, I thought adding jello would ensure it would be quite thick. I was worried it might become too thick and would be difficult to add to the strawberries. Now it's just a sugary soup mess in the bottom of the pie shell.

Have made a few different versions of this pie and this is my fave!! Agree, the amounts for the filling are enough for ONE PIE ONLY. Love the berry points facing up & piling extra - it was perfection. I also made a graham cracker crust (FAR better than pastry crust) and put it in a spring form pan. Makes such a gorgeous pie - took it to a dinner party last night and everyone was amazed I made it myself (embarrassed how easy it is!).

This is my mini tart and pie to go to recipe if i want a strawberry pie!! I loved it. Everyone loved it. I should rate this a 4 due to the fact one recipe was enough for 1pie i found so i doubled the filling recipe then it was enough for two pie but had alittle extra filling. I also used frozeb strawberries and unthawed and drained the extra fluid from srrawberries. This was a hit and i will always use this recipe again and again
I made 1 deep dish 9 inch pie. My dinner party loved it.
the kids really loved this and it came out beautifully. I followed the directions to the letter.

Mine turned out too gelatin-like. I found another recipe like this and it had all the same ingredients, but their recipe called for 2 cups of water instead. Most of the reviews for this other recipe changed the water to 1 1/4 cup water so I think that would help if you don't like your pie filling tasting like Jello. So disappointed! This is so easy to make, I was hoping for a home run.

Use cold water. Only use the amount of sugar you need based on sweetness of berries. For 1 pie do all the same but 2 tablespoons of strawberry jello.

Cook the sugar, cornstarch & water until it's clear. It's not going to be completely clear - rather not white anymore. It will bubble slightly & then get it off the burner. It will be thickened fine. Then add your jello. All should be well unless you took your berries out of the fridge & tried to use them cold. They will weep & you'll end up with a mess.
This pie is simple and amazing. Served it at a dinner party and everyone raved about it. I am wondering, can I prepare this a day or two ahead of time?

My family used to make a pie like this when I was a kid, so I decided to try it for my family after coming across this recipe. The pie is good for if you want a fresh dessert that is not so many calories. This Jello mixture though did not fill 2 pie shells, not even close. I ended up finishing the pies and then having to quickly make more of the mixture to be able to fill the gaps in the pie shells/ cover all of the strawberries. The strawberries are plenty for 2 shells, just double the Jello mixture when you're making it.
Excellent recipie and a snap to make! One I will be making many times again!

Yum! I made this tonight & just had my first bite. It is delicious. I followed MrsKWaters advice & added a bit more sugar to the glaze mix as my strawberries were tart. I also discarded the extra mix. I mounded the strawberries like the directions said, but the filling did not spread out like I thought it would...maybe that's because of discarding the extra glaze mix? But regardless, it is so good. Oh, and I just made the topping as directed, but used brown sugar, & a dash of white. Thanks for a great recipe!
I found this had not enough strawberries for two pies (looked 'naked' almost) and entirely TOO sweet. Not to our liking.
seriously delicious! It screams summer when you used fresh picked strawberries...thanks for a great recipe!

So yummy! 4 or 5 people at the family party I took it to asked for the recipe, and everyone said it was delicious! Very pretty too. I did follow the recommendations of some reviewers and cut up the strawberries, I think it worked well that way.
Delicious! I cut down the sugar to 3/4 cup. I also added just a little bit of almond extract(maybe 1/4 tsp.) I will be making this again soon!

Incredible. We had this for breakfast because I was afraid the filling would be wet if it sat overnight and all day. No worries, I don't think it will wet the crust for 2 days. Definitely not enough sauce for 2 pies, these amounts were perfect for one pie.
Very good! Made it in mini store bought graham cracker crusts...made enough for 6. Next time will try a choc type crust :)
This pie is wonderful! Very easy to make and comes out so pretty. My grandson has diary allergies and this pie is perfect and he loves it! Thanks so much. Perfect!
Great for one pie.... easy and so good. Love using fresh berries and this is a great recipe I I don't skimp on the berries, so I only got one pie!!
Great pie! & so easy!

OMG! Fabulous recipe! Hubby is not a dessert eater but asked to take a piece with lunch the next day. I bought a shortbread crust and added a small jar of lemon curd on the bottom as other reviewers had recommended. The lemon added another dimension of flavor to go with the sweet of the strawberries and sauce. Used the creamiest whip cream in the can. WOW. What a great recipe. I will be trying the diabetic version someone added, for my mother. She is going to love this too. Thanks for sharing this recipe, Janice! :)

This makes a great pie! This recipe is so simple and fresh! I only needed one pie so I halved the recipe. Even though I halved it, I used the whole 3 oz. package of gelatin along with a little more sugar since its winter and the berries right now aren't very sweet by themselves. Making the filling a little sweeter really made up for the dull winter berries and you couldn't tell that the berries weren't at their peak season. The filling amount wasn't enough to fill the entire pie shell up all the way. But it was still delicious. I may double the filling next time. Such a great, light, and easy pie! With a large dollop of whipped cream on top and you have an excellent dessert! Thanks for this great recipe! I will make again and again!
delicious! i sliced the strawberries, it made them easier to eat in the pie, and used my own pie crust recipe. it set up great in the fridge.

this was so good! it took me a really long time though, because i used frozen strawberries and didnt think to thaw them out ahead of time. i made it with a whole weat crust and i think that just perfected it! it cuts the sweetness just enough to make it even better than before. oh, and also, this recipie really only makes one shallow pie, i dont know why it says it makes two.
maybe I didn't have enough strawberries - but I used what recipe called for too much of the filling not enough berries. it kind of looked jello-y
I used a ready made pie crust but it still tasted good. The only thing was the jello didn't set right, so it was a litte runny. It still tasted good, though.
Best Strawberry Pie ever. Didn't change a thing. Worked perfectly, gave it to our new neighbors as a welcome gift and it went over great!

This strawberry pie turned out a little rubbery right out of the refrigerator--the filling. I doubled the filling and had enough for just one pie with the 1 1/2 quarts of berries. Maybe if I'd allowed the pie to sit out and warm up just a bit, it wouldn't have been so firmly jelled. Next time, if I use this recipe again, think I'd add just a little more water, but that is such a hit and miss operation. Just don't think I'd use this recipe again. It was pretty, though!

Only had enough strawberries to make one pie. It was incredible and gone in one day! The filling set perfectly and had just the flavor I was looking for in a strawberry pie. I used the Basic Flaky Pie Crust recipe from this site, and it was the perfect base for this pie.

My sister made this pie for my son's rehearsal dinner. Big, big hit. I have also made this with fresh blueberries nestled between the strawberries and topped with fresh whipped cream stars for all my American holidays

This is a perfect end to any cookout. I smashed about six strawberries and had them cook with the cornstarch, which added a nice flavor. Next time will slice the strawberries, because it was almost impossible to eat with a fork.
Very good - my husband was so happy to see his favorite pie waiting for him when he got home. I will make it again. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

I made this yesterday for dessert & sliced the strawberries as suggested & laid each slice w/ the berry side up throughout the crust for perfect placement instead of just dumping them in the crust.
The recipe calls for 2 tbsp cornstarch..I think if I didn't make the 2 tbsp LEVEL, it would've been a bit thicker. Next time, & there will be a next time, I will put 1/4 tsp more cornstarch in the mixture to be a tad bit firmer, as I would like.
I did use heavy cream to make whipped cream for the topping instead of the whipped cream in the can or cool whip. 
I give this recipe 5 stars because it's a refreshing dessert for these summer days.

This is the same recipe my mother in law gave to me 35 yrs. ago. I had to go looking for a recipe for my daughter in law this year. 
I combine the ingredients a little differently though. I mix the jello, cornstarch and sugar in the pan and add cold water. I stir it until the corn starch is desolved. I bring it to a boil and allow it to boil for 3 about minutes or until it's clear. After it's cooled I pour 1/2 of it into a bowl of berries. I pour that into my pie shell and then pour the remaining glaze over the entire thing.
I've given this recipe away so many times and I'm still approached evrery year to make pies for people.
I've always used the standard Crisco pie crust but my daughter in law wanted to try somethng different so she's using the "French pastry pie crust"
To be continued...
YUM!

So good & easy to make. I followed other's advice & cut the amount of sugar in half & it was still plenty sweet. I used a half cup, any more & it would have been way too sweet. Also I used one 9 inch pie crust and half the amount of strawberries. I did make all the sauce but used only 3/4 of it, again, that was more than enough. Perfect for summer, will definitely make again.
This is fantastic! I have been making this pie for years. I like to make it in a spring loaded pan and make a graham cracker crust. It is really pretty that way.

AWESOME!!! I only had 1-9" pie shell, so I went with it, using 1/2 the strawberries (which I opted to slice), but making the whole amount of 'glaze' (which I used almost all of). This set up quickly and cut beautifully. I garnished this with some whipped topping that was in the fridge. Strawberry pie is one of my hubby's favorites, and this was my first time making it as a surprise to him...he raved! This was so simple, that I will be making this again, for sure v(hubby already informed me of that, lol)! Thanks for sharing. :)
I made this pie with fresh strawberries and made no changes to the recipe. It was delicious. This is definitely a keeper. Thanks for sharing!!

Great taste and easy to make, but there is no way this makes enough filling for two pies. I would use this as a one pie recipe, especially if using the 9 inch crusts.

I replaced all of the sugar with Splenda for one batch, and while it does set up normally it has a strong aftertaste. I'd recommend mixing the sugar with Splenda in a 50/50 ratio.

Very easy and beautiful! I cut the berries in half and arranged them in a circular pattern working from the outside in, with the points facing up. I followed the recipe and because I could fit the berries together more closely, didn't find it necessary to double the gelatin sauce. It was perfect. Because I made mine the day before, I spread a little soft cream cheese over the bottom of the cooled, baked crusts before filling to keep them from getting soggy. Turned out perfectly. Will use this recipe again and again! Thanks!

I make this pie multiple times every summer. It is a huge hit at cook outs and pool parties, especially on patriotic holidays! As others have said I also use all ingredients for ONE pie. My husband's Aunt is diabetic and I've made it with the sugar-free jello for her and it turned out great.
Amazing! Every time I make this pie everyone wants the recipe :)
Really yummy and easy to make!

I put the 1 cup water into the package of strawberries to make some natural strawberry juice; stir together 1 to 2 minutes, remove the juice then add the cornstarch and heat it up in the microwave. You don't need any gelatin for this great recipe. I used my Miracle Baking Powder Pie Crust II recipe on AR for the crust. It was perfect!!
Absolutely delicious! Very easy to make. Not enough for 2 pies, even small pie crusts. A great summer dessert for guests. I loved it!
This was an absolutely amazing pie! It looks as pretty as it tastes too! I've made it twice now, and all my folks love it! This is surely a keeper..so easy to make, low on carbs, and very tasty.
Loved this recipe!!
This is good, I only wish I had sliced the strawberries instead of placing them point up. The pie looked too sparse. Next time I will slice them and see how it turns out. Thanks for sharing!
Very good! I used the advice of Mrs.KWaters and it turned out great!

This was the first strawberry pie I have ever made, and it was wonderful! I followed the recipe exactly and it came out great! The next time I make this I will Quarter the strawberries though. Having them whole made them a little hard to cut, and I had some really big berries. Thanks so much!

although the recipe says "1" package of jello, 3 ounces is several packages. i used two (1.2) ounces, and that was much too much in combo with the cornstarch. the filling was hard to get through, even with a knife. much too thick and sticky.

Amazing! One of the best pies I've ever made! I followed the recipe exactly and added fresh whipped cream when serving. I found the filling was for one pie, also. I made two pies today with fresh picked strawberries - this as my "uncooked" and another from allrecipes as my "cooked". This was the winner hands down! The strawberries' taste did not get lost in the jello and just tasted fresh, light and like the begining of summer!
Question: Can this pie be frozen and thawed for another time?
Pie was amazing! Other reviewers were right though, it isn't enough for 2 pies.

Yummy! Just like the pie from the little mom and pop restaurant i went to as a kid. I did slice the berries instead of using them whole. I did cut the sugar back to 1/2 cup (and it was plenty sweet. Does depend on your berries). This does make only 1 pie worth, so i ended up using more berries and doubling the gelatin mixture.
Not sure what went wrong but my pie came out tasting like jello in a pie crust. I used the 2 tbs of cornstarch as called for but maybe it needs to be increased.

Awesome Awesome pie. Made 3 of them and they are gone because they were such a hit. Thanks for sharing. I did use cold water that I brought to a boil like others suggested and the amount of ingrediants listed was good for 1 9" pie.
Delicious! Reminded me of a pie my grandmother used to make.

My daughter , and myself made this using a store bought crust. The pie is delicious , and very easy to make . Used the same recipe , and switched the strawberries out for peaches , and used peach jello . Same results!! Great Pie!!
